newsitem.title: USA: Chemfab says Montopoli to step down as CEO.
newsitem.headline: Chemfab says Montopoli to step down as CEO.

text.p: Chemfab Corp said Thursday that Duane Montopoli has informed the company he will end his tenure as president and chief executive officer on December 31.
John Verbicky, executive vice president and chief operating officer, will succeed him in both posts.
Montopoli will remain on the Company's board of directors and, effective with the CEO change, current outside director Nicholas Pappas will fill the newly-established office of chairman of the board.
Monopoli said he wanted to try other interests after 11 years in his position.
